qas.question: Who owns the majority of pre-1950 Paramount sound releases?
Who holds TV distribution rights to Paramount's post-1949 releases?
Who manages the TV distribution of Walt Disney Studios?
Who owns the majority of 1950 Paramount sound releases?
Who holds TV distribution rights to Paramount's 1949 releases?
Who manages the TV distribution of Walt Disney Fox?
What is Disney's film output owned by?

context: Most Paramount sound releases made prior to 1950 are owned by <a0_0><b5_0>EMKA, Ltd./NBCUniversal Television Distribution<b5_0/><a0_0/>, while Paramount (currently owned by <a1_0>Viacom<a1_0/>) holds on to most of its post-1949 releases, which are distributed for television by <a2_0><b6_0>Trifecta Entertainment & Media<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Columbia's film output is owned by <b9_0>Sony<b9_0/> (through Sony Pictures Television); distribution of 20th Century Fox's film library is handled for television by its 21st Century Fox subsidiary 20th Television, and the Walt Disney Studios (owned by <a3_0><b7_0>The Walt Disney Company<b7_0/><a3_0/>) has its library film output handled for television by <a4_0><b8_0>Disney-ABC Domestic Television<b8_0/><a4_0/>. Classic films released by 20th Century Fox, Paramount Pictures, Universal Studios, and Columbia Pictures are licensed individually for broadcast on Turner Classic Movies.
